definition: to have real skill/to know one's stuff
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I remember thinking, "Yea, this guy gets it."
sentences.chinese: 我记得当时想，“哟，这个家伙有两下子。
你模仿的还真有两下子。

sentences.english: Small one, you have tow down son.
So either my guthas gone all crazy, or maybe you're the real deal.
sentences.chinese: 要么是我彻底疯掉了，要么是你真的有两下子。

sentences.english: Helen: Your child is really something. She got the 1st prize in the piano contest.
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子真有两下子，居然在钢琴比赛中获得第一名。

sentences.english: For one day I can have two down sons so I can hold to country.
sentences.chinese: 为了有一天我能有两下子，可以报效祖国。

sentences.english: I knew Jack had it in him.

definition: a couple of times/to repeat the same/the same old trick/tricks of the trade
ability/skill
(coll.) not bad/good/fine
You're really quite something!/You're just amazing!
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
the sage presents as an ordinary person (idiom)
(coll.) boy/(derog.) joker/guy/(despicable) fellow
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
jack of all trades
brat/bastard
to act recklessly (idiom)
source material/original story
ability/skill
lit. name is not in vain (idiom); a fully justified reputation/enjoys a well-deserved reputation
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
attractive young man (usually derog.)/pretty boy/gigolo
you can't judge a person by appearance (idiom)/you can't judge a book by its cover/often in combination 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
(derog.) old fool/old bastard
